Reviews.Title: “Old, rundown and scary”
Reviews.Author: Dawns206
Reviews.Content: It is a dump. The lobby doesn't look horrible, however the hallway and rooms are another matter. The carpeting in our room was old and needed a good cleaning and the bed was hard as rock. It just looked dingy. We settled in and my husband got a call to come to the desk. When he got there they said his credit card was declined, except we did not give them a credit card. They seemed a ltitle confused over the fact that the room was already paid for. Now back to the room. We soon realized the window (on a first floor room) did not lock and the bar across it was broken. Great. We went to the desk and were given a different room which was much better than the first including the pillow top mattress. Everything including the sheets and towels are just dingy and old. The entire hotel has an old ,unclean smell. I am not sure why any travel site even lists this. I've stayed in much better hotels for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “If not my worst hotel experience, very close to it.”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because several family members were staying there for a family funeral and the price was economical. When we checked in we were sent to a room with a large box in the middle of the room and there were no heat controls on the unit. Went to the front desk, and they changed rooms for us to a room that had trash in the waste baskets and cigarettes in the ashtray. Went again to the front desk and he offered to change the room yet again. We declined as we were already late to meet family and asked to have houskeeping clean the room for us. When we got back to the room at about 10:30 pm, we turned on the heat and the unit was very loud when it came on. We chose to try to ignore it as we were tired. It woke both my wife and me several times during the night. A very restless night with a funeral and a long drive the next day. I would never consider this hotel again and recommend others think before considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Castleton Square Inn, Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: This establishment was an excellent 'find', amidst a large cluster of big name and higher name motels of very good reputation. This Motel, part of the Best Western Family, was clean, efficient, quiet, and had an admirable staff. In particular, one Mrs Roshni, was extremely gracious, and a bonus to her employer. I would recommend anyone to this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Best Western?”
Reviews.Author: designloverFlanders
Reviews.Content: The Castleton Inn advertises as a Best Western, but there is no BW sign outside. The lady at the desk looked overworked and tired, but the room service was kind. My guess is that this hotel is seriously understaffed. The stairs between the floors were absolutely dirty, for example. Breakfast was extremely poor, the coffee tasted like water and there was barely any bread to be found. The rooms are large enough,the beds were ok; but the walls between the rooms are thin. We had the misfortune to sleep next to a couple that arrived noisily at 4am, and continued partying and making noise until 6.30am. The Internet connection went down every 10 seconds, which is rather annoying if one wants to check mail, etc. If this is a Best Western, then the chain had better invest in a renovation if they want to make this hotel attractive again. For the moment being, I'd definitely look for another hotel (there are more than enough places nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Simpletun
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for two equally balanced reasons - it was in the heart of a shopping area and also the price. We had two rooms for 2 couples and while one was uneventful, the other one had a leaking bathroom from the floor above. We asked for a change and got another room that, we discovered the following morn, was also leaking. Breakfast was not quite there...everyone was waiting (quite a crowd with the Memorial Day long weekend) and the staff appeared to be struggling to decide whether to appease the guests or let them starve. Unfortunately the wait only got the guests exchanging notes of how bad the rooms were and soon the staff decided to get more eats available to quiet the spreading stories. We reduced our stay by a day and moved to a nearby Drury inn....and what an experience, even if the price was higher.

Reviews.Title: “I guess you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PJTMichigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was moderately priced, so we decided to give it a try while we were in town for a wedding. They do provide some hot items for breakfast (no meat), but we had to wait about 15 minutes for the eggs to cook in the microwave, the biscuits were dry and hard, and the juices were mis-labeled. It was pretty sad. We ate out the next day. The building is quite old, and needs renovation. The bathroom fixtures were rusty. The shower curtain smelled moldy. The bed and the bathroom seemed pretty clean, but the carpet was damp and filthy. I made the mistake of walking around barefoot, and found my feet to be very dirty. We didn't let our bare feet touch the carpet after that. If you stay here, take some slippers with you. My recommendation - stay somewhere else - there are a lot of places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Safe but Sparse”
Reviews.Author: RRichardson
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located in a safe and convenient area. We paid $69 + tax for a suite. The room was very sparsely funished and fairly well maintained except for the floor in both the living area and the bedroom. The floor looked like it had not been vacuumed in some time. The sink in the bathroom would drain only if the stopper was manually removed. The continental breakfast was nothing to write home about--we opted to eat in a restaurant. The staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: redhot84chick
Reviews.Content: Nothing too fancy here, but great spot in Indianaapolis!!! My friend and I stayed here & had just all the amenities we needed :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AISM101610
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my weekend trip. It is located in a very convenient spot with access to lots of shopping and plenty of food. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. I plan to return again when just wanting to get away from home for a day shopping and dining out. The prices were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western is fortunate to have Nita managing this hotel. She is the best in the industry!”
Reviews.Author: Dane_Carmel
Reviews.Content: I you are looking for a clean well run moderately priced hotel located on the northwest side of Indy then this is the place. I was especially pleased that this hotel was very well managed by a very kind and helpfull lady named Nita.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillyBoots
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to stay when I travel on business. Rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. They also have a fair rate with todays economy. Restaurant and bars (Hooters and Beer Sellar) and others are walking distance. Always feel safe there. Highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BusinessLady32
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time at this Best Western. The staff is warm and friendly. My room was clean and spacious and I enjoyed all the amenities they offered. The pool is great and the laundry room a plus! I will make it a point to stay at this hotel whenever I come back this way. A+

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: SwayThisWay
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay at this hotel and found the staff to be knowledgeable and courteous. Sometimes it's difficult to judge a hotel on one or two nights, but we have been here for a month and we are extremely satisfied. They were more than willing to go the extra mile to see us happy, and were very attentive to our needs. They're even understanding when you lock yourself out of your room 300 times! The general manager runs a tight ship here, and we are impressed with the staff she has built. I have no problem recommending this hotel to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: dlarner
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia for the Final 4 weekend. I booked it in Aug. 09 for April 2010. I too had a problem with the Manager being dishonest. They claimed I called and cancelled and rebooked so that I ended up with a higher rate. The manager did not return my calls until I call Corporate Best Western and then claimed she called earlier and left a voice mail which I did not get. Beware booking this on sites like Expedia It was my word against theirs. The hotel was subpar at best. The plumbing in our room and our friends needed work and their were ants in both rooms. The workout room had 3 machines and 2 of them were broken.

Reviews.Title: “There was a cockroach in the drapes... Need I say more?!?”
Reviews.Author: LisaWithrow
Reviews.Content: Dirty, spider in the shower, security door broken, carpets and walls stained. I pulled back the drapes in the morning and a roach fell to the floor and scurried behind the dresser. I will NEVER stay in this awful place again. Creepy & dank.

Reviews.Title: “Try "WORST" Western”
Reviews.Author: JMLMississippi
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst Best Western we've ever stayed at. Okay, the room seemed clean, and the location was good (near a Buca di Beppo Italian restaurant and a mall). The electrical outlet at the desk was falling out of the wall; and the GFI outlet at the sink would trip when you plugged in the hair dryer and the coffee pot, OR the lights would dim at the sink and in the bathroom! The batteries in the remote for the television were held in by tape. One of the bedside lamps had the broken switch right next to the lamp, so obviously someone had seen this. And breakfast? The "hot" plate/table was not, and the clerk's response was that there was the microwave right there (sorry - you don't microwave styrofoam plates!). The electrical issues alone make me recommend that this place be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “A fine, quiet place to stay if bypassing the city.”
Reviews.Author: TBayGuy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now in our travels to and from Florida. It has a good location if you're coming or going on Interstate 69. It's a big motel with a friendly front desk. It has been quiet for us, but we're there in the off-season. There are several good restaurants in the area you can walk to (Red Lobster, Hooters, etc.) and a few stores. The rooms are clean and comfortable. There's a nice breakfast room with the basic continental breakfast. Nothing wrong with staying here if you're just looking for a place to spent a night while passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and freindly service with near by mall and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeillinois
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 2 days. We enjoy our stay. The rooms look very clean and seems like new mattress, I had great sleep both nights. Front service was freindly and helpful. The hotel has very nice clean entrance. I would come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific scare!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernInHollands
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a room with a window that was not locked! I was standing next to the window around 7:15 AM heard a noise and saw the curtain billow out into the room. I pulled the drape back and was face to face with a man who was opening the window and coming in! I screamed and yelled at him to get out! I was lucky he took off running! I called the front desk and reported this. They said they would send someone to our room. No one came. I called again and ask if someone was coming and was told they went out and saw no one. I told them I had watched him run away. I was a little rattled and hung up. I called the third time and asked if they wanted to call the police or should I? Police came took our statement and saw the window was not bolted and could not be locked. We checked out and were told the manager would contact us. She called and told us there was a bar in the window casement and that they always made sure it was in place. I told her it was not and we were not paying for the room. She offered to take off $25.00 then and if I didn't agree I would be charged full price! She had no compassion and was very combative!! I would recommend never to stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very un-happy”
Reviews.Author: blacktj
Reviews.Content: Well our night started out with the other group we were with getting there room and it had not been cleaned the bed was not made and the was garbage and dishes all over so they meet us and went to our room to wait for their new room upon entering out room we found a used "CONDOM" right i the middle of the floor. So no we had to go andget a new room ,which is when they told me i could go somewhere else if i wanted (nice buisness practice)well we ended up takeing the smoking roo because it was the only thing open get to the new room and it was dirty also garbage on the floor and dried upo yellow flem in the sink. while we where there our friends got to there room and it had no working air conditioning and no cscreen in the window so they couldnt even open it because they had a 2 and 1 year old with them. so needless to say we where very unhappy and as of now i have conmtacted management and nothing has been done

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay at a very Reasonable Rate”
Reviews.Author: jas32
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay on our way to Bloomington IN. It was graduation weekend so the places in Bloomington were charging their highest rates so we decided to stay about 1 hr away. I found this place located on the NE corner of Indianapolis right next to I-69 and I-465. It is also about a 1/4 mile away from Castleton Square, apparently the biggest shopping mall in Indy. The place is quite decent, very clean and the room we had was quite spacious. It appears it has been recently renovated with new carpeting, bathroom fixtures, decoration and even a brand new shower curtain. It appears that they stopped short of a complete renovation as our king sized bed was clearly tired, the sheets were quite old, and so did the towels. Again, everything was clean but it would have been much, much nicer if they went all the way. The hotel rate was quite a deal so I guess I can't complain too much. Overall a decent stay and will do it again if I have the need.

Reviews.Title: “Again a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel1954
Reviews.Content: Again I stayed at the best western castleton inn and found their staff and facilities great. I could have gone down the road and paid $50.00 for an indoor pool but everything here was warm and welcoming. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Double Dipping Angers Columbus Residents”
Reviews.Author: bjbc00
Reviews.Content: I had schedled this hotel along with the rest of our 10 year old's baseball team for June 30th through July 3rd. Due to reasonable and unforeseen circumstances, we were forced to abandon the trip. Despite a cancellation attempt 10 days in advance of the reserved date, our entire team was charged for the rooms (over $3,500 total). On one of the busiest weekends of the season, clearly, the rooms were re-booked. We are victime of double dipping.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: omsktravel
Reviews.Content: We were originally scheduled to go to this hotel in June of 2006. Trip was cancelled and we tried to cancel our reservation. Manager was extermely rude and refused to cancel 3 weeks before our scheduled arrival day. Our credit card was charged $345 and we never stayed one night in this hotel. Be aware! Fraud alert! We are considering legal action now.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Wanted”
Reviews.Author: poepoe
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the facility. There was a continental breakfast which suited me fine. I wanted a place to stay near the W. University that was reasonable because I would not be there much except to sleep and shower. The hotel had been remodeled and everything was freshly painted and the carpeting was new in most places I saw. Good sized TV for what time I was in room. Clean bathroom. If you are looking for something reasonable, clean with pleasant staff--this is the place. I certainly will return if I go to workshops in the area again.

HotelInfo.Name: Magnuson Hotel Castleton Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 8300 Craig St., Indianapolis, IN 46250
